dialogues.text: "Describe in detail your opinion of -the historical event that took place in the early morning of October 4th, 1993." What's that?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: The night Derek wasted those guys. Davina takes a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Sweeney gave you this?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: (continuing her reading) "Before and after...how has this event helped or hurt your present perspective concerning life in contemporary America. Use the standard five paragraph format, blab blab blah--this'll be good for you..

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Nooo...it'll be good for you. She stares at him for a good three seconds.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Eat me, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Come on! Dick Nixon's playin' at Cammeron's tonight. You owe me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: I'm not doing your homework for you! I gotta spreadsheet due!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Goddammit! Davina walks to the door and looks back to her brother.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you? You wanna be a fuckin' loser your whole life? Not receiving a response, she walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Asshole Sweeney. He slowly begins to strike the computer keys. The screen reads "People look at me and they see my brother. That's the way things have gone since the murder of our father," TIGHT ON DANNY.  The frustated kid sits and thinks to him himself.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: THE BROAD EXPANSE OF AN EMPTY, DIMLY LIT PARKING LOT. In the distant corner we see a few parked cars and a group of skins gathering.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: It was lunacy after he left us. All the time. Derek believed in Cammeron...he was angry...that combination gave them bodies. White punks...sick of gettin' their asses kicked by black and mexican gangs at school. TIGHT ON DANNY LEANING AGAINST AN ADJACENT CAR. Seven skins, including Seth and Curtis, smoke and wait. DANNY'S POV. Danny looks to his left and sees Derek with Cammeron, who sits in the driver's seat of the BRONCO. Stacey leans in from the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: I hope you kill that fucker. Derek looks back at her and straight to Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: He might have a gun.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Are you going in or not?

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: You know I got the cops on me. If I come up on one of those cameras I'm a dead man. Derek stares at the older man, who appears nervous.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: Somebody needs to drive, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (referring to his mouth) All right. You can turn it off now. (back to Stacey) You're right on his tail, right?

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: (nodding) I hate that fucking Korean.  I hope you smash his face in.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Just be ready, okay? She nods and Derek gets out. The group is silent.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's pull it together. Hey! We're not playing fuckin' games here. Let's go. The group snaps to attention behind him as Seth toys with the camera. CURTIS from earlier takes a hit off a joint and makes Derek wait for him. Derek walks over to the crazy man, takes the joint, and throws it onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What the fuck, Curtis? You a fuckin' nigger now? Want some crack?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (grabbing his neck) Pull your fucking stupid head out of your ass then.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Okay. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (to the group) We're here tonight cause we got immigration problems spiralling out of control. We got Asians up the ass... taking over our land with their fucking Yen. Mexicans...flocking into this place like some giant fucking Pinata was shattered. The group busts up. Cammeron watches Derek and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Don't laugh. It's tragic. On the Statue of Liberty it says "Give me your tired, your hungry, your poor, your huddled masses...yearning to be free." It does not say give me your shiftless, your greedy, your indolent, your criminals, looking for a free ticket. The group agrees.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: We're here tonight to show the government how we feel about minorities taking over our country. The treat us like criminals while they reward them with jobs and fucking welfare checks. And it's only getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: ET AL
dialogues.text: (nodding) Fuck yeah it is.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Are you ready to do something about it?

dialogues.speaker: ET AL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Okay then. AND THEY'RE MOVING.  In formation.  Fast.  Directly at us.    Angry. As the camera swings into line, TRACKING WITH THEM, Derek reaches into his back pocket and pulls out a STOCKING MASK. He pulls it down over his face. The foot soldiers follow him in unison.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (back to his troops) Remember. No names. Danny?  Stay right on my fucking ass, man. And now they're getting ahead of us. As the CAMERA SWINGS behind them, we see their destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They storm the front entrance. The few people who are in there scream and scramble for cover. Derek grabs a Mexican boxboy and throws him to the ground. Seth catches up to another and gets him on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Wheto's your fucking green card, asshole? Seth kicks the young man in the face with a blatant shot and continues. DEREK leaves a terrified white woman alone like she's not even there and pushes over an adjacent shelf, knocking over another worker with CANS OF BEANS.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (referring to the border) Can't hide from me, motherfucker! He kicks the man and looks around the market for more. Danny watches in awe. Curtis breaks a giant jelly jar over a head. Another skin throws a BLACK CHECKER into a shelf of POTATO CHIPS. DEREK'S POV. He looks up at one of the aisle mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes out with a pistol. He takes aim on Curtis and--

dialogues.speaker: FROM OUT OF NOWHERE, DEREK TAKES A MOP TO THE OWNER'S
dialogues.text: HEAD AND PROCEEDS TO KICK HIM. Danny looks at Derek like he's Superman. Derek looks to his watch and straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Let's go! We're outta here!  Move ! From just inside the door we see skins get in their last blows and pour out the aisles and pass us through the doors. TIRES SCREECH. THE CAMERA HOLDS ON THE WRECKAGE OF THE MARKET AND THE MOTIONLESS BODIES ON THE FLOOR;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off his stocking mask and stares at his stone- faced brother.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: And before Derek could even blink...he had a crazed army behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sparks up a cigarette and types on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: Willing to follow his word like it was the word of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rain falls, we see the Vinyards sitting at the table. Stacey and Murray Rosenberg, Doris' then boyfriend who we met earlier, round out the clan. Stacey sits close to Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: And then came October 4th, 1993.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris looks wonderful while Murray, mustache and beard, shakes his head at Derek as he chatters away.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: Things were fine on the homefront. My Mom had a good job but a below average boyfriend. We had a four-bedroom house that Dad left us with. Everyone was happy. TIGHT ON DEREK. Shaved head, rolled-up sleeves, tattoos, loosened tie, LA COPY CENTER name tag from earlier. His charisma draws their attention as he rambles over the crackling rainfall.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: Everyone but Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Murray. White men don't cruise the streets of LA killing each other.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: No.  You guys make bombs. Derek stares at the man, eyes filled with homicide.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: You're so fucking lame. A couple of cranks in cabins in Montana is not statistically significant. (then) White Americans don't take PCP and drink and drive a hundred and twenty fuckin' miles an hour! We pull over and trust the law.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Don't you know, Murray? White people never break the law. We're perfect little angels.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: That's not what I said, Davina. (to the group) Three different times Rodney King comes at those officers with the intent to hurt them. To hurt them! Three times! But since we see it on some fucking tampered videotape...the bleeding heart media makes you believe that he only comes at them once. All we see is Powell, Koon and Wind hittin' him and-- (busting up laughing) Briseno kickin' him in the back of the fuckin' skull with his boot. Still, the dumbfuck's tryin' to get up and kick their asses! That's how stupid that motherfucker is. Those cops used textbook-solid tactics and if Dad were still here he'd say the same damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: That doesn't make it right.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Yes it does. Yes it does. They're cops! They are taught to use that stick and they did.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Excessively.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: No. Appropriately. Appropriately! Cops have been granted a certain amount of authority by society and white people, unfortunately, are the only ones who acknowledge it. I acknowledge a cop's authority. Davina starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Look who's talking about respecting the law? Mr. K.K.K. here.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: That's two errors in one sentence, Davina, so take a fucking course in semantics. First error--I didn't say I respect the law. I said I respect a cop's authority. Second error...I'm not a member of the fuckin' low rent, disorganized, redneck Ku Klux Klan.. Pull your head outta your ass and look at who you're dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Don't speak to her that way, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Murray, stay out of it. You're not a member of this family and you never will be.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: What the hell does that have to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: (to Derek) You know...sometimes it's hard to believe I gave birth to you.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Give thanks to the food on the table and then believe it, Doris.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: We both put food on this table, fella.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: True enough. The point is...if Dan was walking across the street that night and Rodney King plowed into him--

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Can we forget about Rodney King for chrissake?!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (fiercely continuing) --while hopped up on Chivas and P.C.P...you'd consider the force those cops used to be justified!

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: He didn't hit anybody!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: If he did though! If that shithead killed Dan...you would have believed the beating to be justified and so would everybody else. But since he didn't hit anyone...it's "Hands Across America" for the son of a bitch. Derek takes a bite of food.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: We are still so hung up in this notion that we have an obligation to help the struggling black man and all you contribute to it! Lincoln freed the slaves a hundred and thirty years ago! Get off your fucking asses!

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: I'm with you, honey. All the way. It's one...giant...ploy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: I mean...nobody likes Chief whatever his name is, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Gates.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. So here comes this filthy piece of garbage in his Hyundai. He pulls over in front of a perfectly lighted area where a video camera is sitting there...fucking waiting for him, man. What happens next? Chief Gates is dust. It's total-- Davina drops her silverware on the plate with a clatter and looks at her mother. Everyone stares at Davina.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: (to Doris) May I be excused please?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Don't interrupt, Davina.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: I didn't interrupt shit.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: The hell you didn't. I was listening to Stacey and then I heard you. That's called interrupting. Wait 'til she's finished and you can be excused.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you think you are? Derek jumps up from the table and grabs her by the back of the hair.  The table JOLTS and plates tumble to zhe floor.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: You don't know when to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Dammit Derek!

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: What are you trying to prove, man?! Derek turns and laughs at Murray.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I'm trying to teach my sister some respect, Murray.

dialogues.speaker: DAVI NA
dialogues.text: Let go of my fucking hair!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (to Murray) See! See the way she speaks! Tell me you're gonna shut up and I'll let go.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Derek!  Let go of her hair and sit down!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I will when I hear an answer, Doris. Are you going to shut up, Davina? TIGHT ON DANNY. He gets up quickly and tries to pull Derek off. Derek turns and cracks Danny in the face with a BACKHAND, dropping him back into a cabinet. A crystal vase with flowers crashes to the floor, just missing Danny's head.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (to Danny) What are  you thinkin'?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Danny?!  Are you okay?! Danny nods his head as everyone looks at Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: It's a real easy question, Davina. A simple yes or no will suffice. Tell me what I want to hear and I'll let go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Fuck...you. Derek takes a piece of roast beef off her plate and shoves it in her mouth. Me holds the whole piece inside so she can't spit it out. Davina cries as she chokes on the meat.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: She can't breathe, Derek!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Stay back, both of you!  It's her bed, she's gotta lie in it. (grabbing harder) You can cry all you want, Davina. I'm not gonna let go until you tell me what I wanna hear! Are you going to shut that fat fucking mouth of your's and let my girlfriend tell her opinion? Are you?! DORIS grabs him from behind and he aggressively turns on her. Derek curls his tongue behind his teeth and raises his arm like he's actually going to smack his mother. She grabs his arm though, forcefully.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Let go of her hair and get out. Derek releases his grip on his sister and she spits the roast beef onto the floor. She runs into the back bedroom crying, choking and coughing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA, (O.S)
dialogues.text: I hate you, you fucking asshole! The door slams shut in the background.  Doris, Murray, Danny, and Stacey all stare at Derek.  Derek calmly faces his brother.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: You okay? Danny nods.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: (softly) Psycho. IN SLO MO--Time FREEZES as Derek slowly turns his head back to Murray. ON THE TRACK we hear a few keys being typed and then silence. A cigarette sizzles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a long drag off his cigarette and exhales. He slowly runs his hands over his stubbly head, marveling at the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek smiles at Murray in wonder and disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Would you care to repeat that, Murray? I'm not sure I got all of it.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: (smiling) He called you a "psycho", honey.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (smiling back) Was that it?    Thanks Murray.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: See. Here we go again with this, Derek. Making me out to be the bad guy again.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: You callin' me a liar, RosenKike?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: (to Stacey) Hey goddammit! You talk to me with respect or--!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Or what, Murray!? What're you gonna do? Give her fucking detention?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Both of you get out right now. Murray stares at Derek with pity.  Doris becomes emotional.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: (to Derek) Do you think you're the only one who's affected around here? Derek focuses on his mother for a moment. A captivated Danny watches and waits as Derek turns to Murray.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Out of respect for my mother...I'm gonna let that comment go, Murray. I won't bash your face in. But let me tell you somethin'...man to fuckin' mouse here. Normally in a situation like this I'd take my steel-tips to your fucking Jewish temple. That goes for anyone making comments about me, my family, Stacey, whomever. You know and I know that I could crush that puny fuckin' skull of yours in a second. So it's beyond me why you would say something like that without being able to back it up? What's worse, you sack of shit, is you calling the woman I love a liar.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: I never said she was a liar.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Weasel like that again Murray...you fuckin' ponytail, pussy, bagel eating, teacher, faggot...and I'll cut your shylock nose off. Make no mistake. Murray silently walks out of the house. Derek claps and sings the Jewish celebration song "Hava Naghila." Stacey joins in and the two laugh. Doris goes after Murray.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Murray Rosenberg...International Jew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray goes to his car and Doris follows.  Danny watches from the door.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: He's a stupid kid, Murray!  I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: He's not a kid, Doris. We were kids. We didn't call people kikes.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: It's just gonna take some time with him. What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: You don't know your children, Doris! You have no clue about the world they live in. Your son is a terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: He's not a terrorist, Murray.  Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: He's a member of the Disciples of Christ. You remember that grocery store incident?!

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Murray?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: My sister and her two kids got evacuated from her Temple in Woodland Hills!

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Murray! Please! Derek would never have anything to do with bombs, okay?! You don't know him like I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I wouldn't want to. Goodbye. Murray gets inside and goes down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY'S POV -- He watches Doris stand alone, her face in her hands, crying. BEHIND Dan a humiliated Davina storms towards Derek, now wielding a BASEBALL BAT.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Davina? Derek hears Dan and looks out of the corner of his eye. He spots her at the last moment.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Take this, you fucking dick! Derek pops up quickly, disarms her, and pulls her close.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Davina!  It's okay!  Calm down.   Please.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Let go!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (whispering in her ear) I'm sorry, Davina. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Let go of me!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Come on, Davina.  I'm sorry. I lost control. Please.  I screwed up. Derek holds tight until the crying girl settles down. He's gripped as desperately by remorse as he was moments before by rage. He kisses and repeats his apology over and over. Finally, she succumbs and puts her arms around him. Derek looks to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (hugging Davina) You guys are my life and I'd do anything for you. You do know that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: (wiping her tears) I don't believe you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I swear to God I would, Davina. Please.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I believe you, Der. Derek smiles at his little brother, lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Davina? Please forgive me.  Please. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: (nodding, after a beat) That fuckin' sucked, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I know it did. And I'm sorry. I just really hate that guy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: You couldn't tell. A RAINSOAKED DORIS walks through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Find an apartment because I want you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Morn, I'm sorry but that guy's--

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: I don't wanna hear it anymore!  I want you out!

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: He can move in with me.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Good. She walks past Derek and into the back bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises from the computer and PEEKS out the blinds. The two cops supposedly watching Derek are now eating in the car. One of them looks up. Danny flips the blinds down. From the other room, he hears Doris break into another coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits beside her and hands her a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Thank you, honey. She coughs, recovers, and sips. Danny walks away.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Hey. Come here.  Sit with me.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I've got this thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: You can sit down for two seconds. He looks at her and sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Don't breathe on me.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: I won't. They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It's cold in here, no wonder your sick. She stares and smiles at him for a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: What? I'm not allowed to look at you anymore? He smothers her face with his hand, jokingly.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No. You're not.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: (laughing) Daniel Patrick! Stop it! Are you ever gonna let that beautiful hair grow back?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Nope. Never.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: I bet you will. He smiles and locks eyes with his mother for several moments. He finally rises and walks back to his room.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: If you need me to proof anything for you I will.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Wake up early if you get tired. Doris watches him disappear down the hall, distant thoughts creeping back slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a flannel and throws it on. He sees a cigar box that rests on the right shelf. He grabs it and looks inside. The rolled-up LA TIMES clipping reads "Prominent Skinhead Charged with Murder." The accompanying picture of Derek is near evil. TIGHT ON HIS EYES.  Danny stares at the clipping.  ON THE TRACK--GUNSHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Derek fire his gun at the TRANS AM as it blazes down the street. He walks over to the wounded man on the lawn and points his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Get on the floor, Danny!  Jesus! Danny looks down at her and hurries out of his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hovers over big Lawrence. Gun pointed steadily, he kicks him in the stomach over and over -- tongue pressed against teeth.  Hot air flows from Derek's breath and into the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked with the wrong bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, man! Danny watches his brother from the front porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the cops handle it, Der!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Fuck that. The cops will let him walk. Derek grabs Lawrence and drags him to the CURB.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Ever shoot at firemen, you fuck? (then) Open your mouth and put it on the corner of the curb. I'm gonna teach you a little lesson.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Derek!?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Get in the fucking house, Dan! Danny doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Come on, man. Call an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: My dad gave me that truck, motherfucker. Couldn't leave well enough alone. Put your mouth on the corner of the fucking curb! Derek cocks his piece and Lawrence complies--his teeth now scraping concrete. SIRENS sound from afar. Danny walks out into the middle of the street to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: The cops are comin' Der'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence mumbles something unintelligible from his outstretched mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you say?  You just threaten me? Hunh? Hunh? Hunh?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (anticipating) No! Derek STOMPS his foot on the back of LAWRENCE'S head - completely tearing his jaw in half on the curb's corner.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (crying) Holy fucking shit!  Derek!    What the hell was that for?!  Jesus! The two lock eyes. Derek does not flinch. Helicopter lights shine on the house. COP CARS SCREECH TO A HALT. DANNY'S POV. Two cops take cover behind their door, draw their guns, and shout instructions. Derek puts the gun down, puts his arms behind his head, and drops to his knees. His eyes are remorseless.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: Joseph Conrad once wrote that "murder is always with us. It's almost an institution." That couldn't rang more true than with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE PATROL CARS, a FIRE TRUCK, TWO AMBULANCES, and a throng of terrified NEIGHBORS strangle the front of the house. Clothed and handcuffed, Derek is escorted from the house by two uniformed cops and RASMUSSEN.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: Bobby Lawrence died of massive head trauma early that morning. Derek marches past the bodies -- which are being tended to thoroughly.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: Six months after that...Derek was convicted and sentenced to seven years for voluntary manslaughter...to be served at the California State Penitentiary in Chino. Rasmussen forces Derek's head down and he gets in the car. He stares at his brother and sister as police lights flash on him. Then to Stacey. Finally, to a lifeless Doris. They lock eyes as the patrol car takes off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: Prosecutors wanted murder one for my brother's torture method...but there wasn't enough "premeditated" evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clearly focus on the computer. HIGHLIGHTED is the sentence "There might have been if I testified." Only when he hits the DELETE KEY does it disappear. He continues typing. DANNY (V/O)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Over the next year we'd lose our house and the rest of our father's pension to attorney fees. My mother...much to all of our surprise...stood by Derek. Danny's interrupted by a LOUD KNOCK on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks through the PEEPHOLE and sees it's CHRIS AND JASON. He sighs in relief and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We're here, dude.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Drop your dick and grab your stick.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I told you I can't tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (from the couch) Danny?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It's okay, Mom. The two punks laugh as Danny pushes them and their boards back to his bedroom.  He shuts his bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks at the two.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: If I don't finish this thing I'm dead.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Just tell 'em you'll do it tomorrow. You can't miss the party.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Fire pie Lizzy called and told us to  grab your ass.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She did?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (nodding) You gotta hit that shit.  It's the  only fun thing that's legal anymore. The PHONE RINGS and Danny grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only illumination shines through the window from the  street.  Holding his briefcase, he stands over his desk phone, all packed up and almost out the door.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Dr.  Sweeney.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (worried) What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Nothing here. Is everything all right over there?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: How's it comin'?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I'm doing it right now.

dialogues.speaker: CMRIS
dialogues.text: Who is it, dude?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (covering the receiver) It's Sweeney.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Who?! Why is he calling here!?  Fuck you, Sweeney! Asshole!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (grabbing the receiver) Get a fucking job, you reggie! Danny grabs the receiver back and yells at his friends.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You fuckers are going to get me booted! (into the receiver) Dr. Sweeney? I'm sorry, man.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Just make sure it's on my desk tomorrow, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It'll be there, alright!?

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: It better be. Sweeney hangs up abruptly. Danny slams the phone on the hook, gives it TME FINGER, and looks at his friends.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUCK sits across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in the car as a band JAMS from Cam's house. Shiftless Seth throws on a black CRO-MAG t-shirt and tosses his work shirt in the back. He wolfs down a burger as Derek rolls his foot on a basketball on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: You're an idiot if you ask me.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I'm not asking you.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: What if he writes something stupid and that nigger turns you in? Jesus. He didn't testify, Der. They can use that shit and re-try you. Derek takes a long stare at Seth, who devourshis burger.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Sweeney's not gonna do anything, Seth. He helped get me released. Seth is a pathetic vision to Derek.  Derek stares at him for several moments.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I'm out, Seth. Seth wipes his mouth and casually meets eyes with Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I'm only going to tell you this once so pay attention. I'm done, Seth. I don't want you to come near me...near Dan...I want you to leave my family alone. Seth stares and laughs at Derek.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: You're serious.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I'm dead fucking serious. No more phone calls, no more visits, no more nothing. Seth doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: We don't exist as far as you're concerned, Seth.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm hearing this shit come out of your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Believe it, Seth. Believe it. I spent over three years away from my family. My family, Seth. For what?

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: For your country, fuckhole, that's what. I'd do a hundred years before I felt like that. Seth gets out, slams the door, and walks to the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a motherfucking traitor! Derek stares out the window and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches the house. Suddenly, Danny, Chris and Jason skate up to the residence and follow Seth inside.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What the--? Shit.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: DICK NIXON plays a punk version of WHITE CHRISTMAS as skins slam dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face is tattooed with crow's feet and prison ink. CASSANDRA, a frail, older, English woman with green hair and multiple piercings, approaches JASON at the keg.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: You're full of shit!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: If he ain't here, he's comin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, Danny and Jason pound beer and huck DARTS at a picture of O.J. SIMPSON. Seth violently slams past the kids. Derek walks in.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Yo!  What's up, Fat Seth!? Seth throws Chris against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: I'm not fat, cockwart!  I'm husky!

dialogues.speaker: CMRIS
dialogues.text: Okay! I'm sorry, bro!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Take it easy, dude! Seth then grabs Danny hard by the shirt.  Chris and Jason stare at him like he's gonna hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What're you doin'?!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Your brother's a piece of shit! Seth sees Derek enter and he releases Danny. Seth mixes into the party and SLAM DANCES into ten other skins. Danny follows Seth towards the keg. DEREK'S POV. He analyzes the crowd.  Quickly, Chris recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Holy shit.  Father Vinyard!?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Derek looks at the two kids.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I'm Jason and that's Chris! We're friends with your brother! They stick out their hands but Derek prefers to check the scene.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You're a fuckin' god, man!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: No shit!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Do me a favor.  Grab Danny and get outta here! The two boys look at each other and LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We just got here, man!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: You what!? Chris looks at Derek like he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: You don't have any homework?!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: School doesn't exist anymore, Father. Derek stares at him, not really knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I wrote you. Two letters while you were in there! Did you get them?! Derek ignores them and weaves his way through the crowd, causing many an individual to double-take. Chris and Jason look on in wonderment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON CAMMERON ALEXANDEr. The older, white trash skin furiously bangs his sticks on the drums to the song. Cam's hair is still long but now he's got a swastika between his eyebrows like CHARLES MANSON. He wears TROY AIKMAN'S DALLAS JERSEY and a BLACK COWBOY HAT. DEREK'S POV. He pans right to check out the crowd. A man pisses out the window. Then to a distinct woman. IT'S STACEY. Her head is now completely SHAVED but she's still gorgeous as ever. Derek indulges her for a few moments until he turns and walks away.  He bumps into a girl and knocks her drink.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: Excuse fuckin' me!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Sorry. She smiles at Derek as the SONG comes to a close.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: Derek?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Cassandra.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: Oh my God! They said you might be here but I didn't fucking believe 'em! CURTIS, the M-16 on the side of his head perfectly intact, walks by Derek. He walks past Derek with his young son on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: I hope what I heard ain't true, man. You better hightail it the fuck outta here if it is. After a moment, Derek looks away and Curtis heads off.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: You gotta chop that mop, Der! Cassandra lights a brown menthol cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: (exhaling) Stacey's meandering around here somewhere! Have you seen the bitch?! Derek shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: The only person I've seen is Seth.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: Oh God.  I'm sorry. DEREK'S POV. He sees Cameron puts his arm around her and kiss her. Cameron sticks his hand down the back of her pants, smiles, pulls it out, and licks his finger. Derek watches as Danny delivers a beer to Cammeron.  Ca puts his arm around Dan and they go into the bedroom. Stacey looks at Derek and follows them.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZY, (0. S.)
dialogues.text: Are you going in there? Derek looks down to see Lizzy and Kammi.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZY
dialogues.text: Can you tell Danny that Lizzy's looking for him? Derek can only stare at the girl's youth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREM'S PoV. He stands in the doorwell and listens. White Power paraphernalia cover the walls. Articles, posters, everything. The room has a bed, a couch, a glass coffee table and a desk with a computer on it. Organized stacks of papers, pamphlets and magazines are strewn throughout the floor. Cameron sips a beer and talks with Dan. Stacey listens in the background.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: He won't do anything'drastic I hope.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I gotta do that paper though.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: I thought you already turned that fucker in?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: My teacher cried to Sweeney, man. have to do another one. Cammeron laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: Oh man.  Fucking Sweeney.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: (chiming in) Meanwhile, niggers and spics do their reports on Malcolm X and fucking Fidel Castro. Cameron laughs again but then becomes quickly serious.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: Sweeney's got an agenda, Danny. And it's all a load of crap. You hear me? He's all about brainwashing. Don't get fucking fooled by it.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here, Dan? They all look over.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: (smiling) Hey. I was wondering when he was going to show his face. Derek doesn't lift his eyes from Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What did I tell you, Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I had to check it out, Der.  Come on. CAMMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be all right, Derek. Derek shoots Cameron a look and tries another way. DEREK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a redhead out there looking for you. Go talk to her. Danny gets up and walks out. Cam looks to Stacey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go with. Derek seizes his brother with the eyes as he exits.  Then Stacey.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Welcome back. He just closes the door on her.  Cammeron looks for his cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: You made it, man. When I heard they threw you in General Population I thought it was curtains.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: It wasn't too bad.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: So what's all this self-righteous, born-again shit I'm hearing then? Derek doesn't blink.  Cameron smiles and points to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: Have a seat, Derek.  Relax. TIGHT ON CAMMERON. He sparks up a cigi to break Derek's uncomfortable stare.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: How was it in there with all those fuckin' monkeys, man?  You're lucky they didn't kill you.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: Who runs the place?  The monkeys or the wetbacks?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: The Mexicans.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: It's a fuckin' vacation for them in there, hunh?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: They were really organized. I'll tell ya...it was impressive. They--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The two make out. She sits on the sink and wraps her legs around him. They stop and smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZY
dialogues.text: I like you.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I like you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Cam converse over the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: They're fuckin' peasants, Derek.  All of them. (then) So what's up, man? I'm hearing a lot of shit about you.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Be careful with me, Cam. You don't know what's going on with me.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: Fuckin' talk to me then. We're family here. Let's work it out whatever it is.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I'm family, Cam? Is that why you came to see me all the time up there? Cameron smiles but doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: I had to distance myself from you after that.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Cameron. You're a fucking chicken hawk...praying on kids.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: I don't pray on fucking anyone.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: No. You fucking use them.  To filter your insanity. Cameron smiles in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: You and Danny are like brothers to me, Derek. Come on, man.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: He's not your brother, Cameron.  All right? He's my brother. (after a beat) You hear me, Cam?

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: (exploding) Fuck you, Derek! Fuck you! Don't think you can threaten me with this shit for a fuckin' second! I'm more important to him now then you ever were. Derek EXPLODES. With his feet, he pushes the GLASS COFFEE TABLE hard into Cammeron's knees. Cam screams in agony. Derek SLUGS him in the face and Cam RETALIATES with two of his own. They wrestle around the room and push their way into the BATHROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek takes Cam by his long hair and SMASHES his face into the mirror. IT SHATTERS. Derek follows with a solid punch to the kidney.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: You gonna listen?!

dialogues.speaker: CAMMERON
dialogues.text: I'm gonna fuckin' kill you. Derek bangs Cam's face against the mirror ONCE MORE.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up! You're gonna stay away! That's what you're gonna do! Derek rinses Cam's bloody face off by PLUNGING it into the toilet. He pulls him back up and they face the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: It's over. Derek stares at him in silence. CAMMERON RETALIATES. He forcefully backs Derek into the wall behind him. He throws two punches at Derek -- one in the stomach and one to the face that opens his lip. He misses on his third and Derek gets the upper hand. BACK TO THE MIRROR. Derek prepares to crash Cam's face into the shards of glass one last time. The final blow. As Cam screams, Derek launches him forward then pulls back at the very last moment. Derek, noticing Cam's condition, throws him into the tub. Derek throws him a towel, grabs one for his lip, and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They SALUTE the band and chant as they tune up for another set. The singer inquires about his DRUMMER. Derek pushes his way through and spills a few beers cn the way. Cassandra smokes a cigarette with a few random skins as Derek passes by.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM SKIN
dialogues.text: Hey Derek!?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: (exhaling) Jesus, Der.  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (psychotically) Where's Cammeron, man?!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I haven't seen him. Cassandra looks at him curiously and then focuses her attention to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY, (O/S)
dialogues.text: Hey! Derek turns around and faces her.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (pointing his finger) Stay away from me.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Don't point your fucking finger at me.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I'm serious, Stacey!  Stay away! She grabs and pulls on his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?! Hunh?! Hit me?! Kick me as I roll on the fuckin' ground screaming?! (then) That bullshit with Cammeron is nothing, Derek!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I don't care. Stacey looks deep into his eyes and can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Goddamn you, Derek! Those two niggers deserved what they got. They deserved to die! And just like Cameron and Seth and a million others out there...I'll believe that 'til the day I fucking die. I will. Nothing will ever change that either. Derek breaks from her grasp and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over to the kegs. Through the sliding glass window, he sees Seth taking a "tap hit" off the keg. All the guys in the b.g., INCLUDING DANNY, count and cheer. Seth sucks the tap while skins count in the background. Derek walks out and watches Dan pump the keg.

dialogues.speaker: ET AL
dialogues.text: Forty-five! Forty-six!  Forty- seven...! Seth removes his mouth from the tap and belches like a pig. All the guys laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: (grabbing Danny) Why the fuck did you pump it?! I coulda gone for a minute at least! Danny looks over and meets eyes with a bloody Derek.  He FREEZES while everyone turns to look Derek over.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Let him go, Seth. Seth sees blood on Derek's face and shirt and takes a moment to identify the source. He draws his 9mm Baretta and points it at Derek's head from four feet away.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Where's Cameron? Derek stares directly into the BARREL.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (frightened) Seth, man!? Come on! Seth puts the gun directly to Derek's cool head.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: I'd be doing America a great fucking favor, let me tell you.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Do it, Seth. Seth glances at her and Derek quickly GRABS the pistol. A shot goes off and people hit the deck. Derek wrestles the pistol away and punches Seth in the STOMACH. Falling to the ground in pain, Derek cracks him in the face once more and it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in and look at Cammeron, bleeding in the tub. Curtis pulls the METAL TOWEL HOLDER off the wall and storms after Derek. Cassandra laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: You got fuckin' guests out there, Cam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek tosses the gun over the fence and looks to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Come with me right now. He looks at his brother. He then sees Curtis and three other skins come through the house. Derek stares at Dan and hauls ass down the back alley. DANNY'S POV. Curtis arrives and tends to Seth rather than go after Derek. Confused and mildly embarrassed, Danny bolts back into the house to get his board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny passes them on his board as he conguers the cracks in the street at an incredible rate. He turns the tight corner and cuts off a turning car. The man yells. Danny spots his brother walking twenty yards up on the left-hand side of the street and crosses. Approaching quickly, he skates faster and faster as Derek nears a BUS STOP BENCH. Hearing the board, Derek turns to face the clickity clack behind him. DANNY LUNGES FROM HIS BOARD AND TACKLES DEREE. The two crash into the street as a car henks from the inside lane, barely missing the duo. Danny punches his brozher in the face.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Fucking asshole! Derek gets on top of his brother, spots a speeding car heading right for him, and pulls his brother to the sidewalk. Just in time.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What the luck are you thinking!?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What are you thinking!? Friends don't fight friends, Der! They stick together!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: They're not friends, Dan!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What the hell are they then?! Derek picks his brother up and sits him on a BUS STOP BENCH.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Just sit there and relax for a second.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I don't wanna relax!  You looked like an idiot back there! Derek stares and sits next to him. Cars and homeless randomly pass in the b.g. Danny looks at his brother, transfixed in thought.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What's happened to you, Derek? TIGHT ON DEREK. He looks into his brother's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FILING OUT OF THE CELL.
dialogues.text: The morning drill. His roommate, an old Latino guy, right behind. Derek's eyes cast among the inmates, noting everyone and looking for a friendly face. He notes a familiar tattoo, catches the guy's eye and nods. WALKING THROUGH THE CAFETERIA. Derek with his tray. A sea of tables divided by race. He spots a tiny island of white guys at a distant table. He looks at STEVIE THE LEADER, but gets a nod from the HUGE ARYAN next to him. Derek moves to sit with them. A WIDE SHOT OF THE YARD. From a distance, he approaches the Aryan corner. They casually greet each other. Derek then looks over to the HUGE ARYAN from the cafeteria and to STEVIE MCCORMICK, the crazy looking leader. Derek walks over and shakes their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek quietly folds towels with a young, chattering black man.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: You got lucky, man. I was in the kitchen for a year before making it in here. Pots and motherfucking pans... disgusting beef stroganoff shit... boiling hot water...fuck that! (looking over) My name's Lamont, man. Derek doesn't even look at LAMONT.  Stone cold, he continues folding.

dialogues.speaker: LAMONT
dialogues.text: I got your back. Righteous white Cracker with attitude. Just like the Judge who sentenced me, man. Lamont laughs but then becomes serious.

dialogues.speaker: LAMONT
dialogues.text: If your smart though you'll remember one thing. You're the nigger in here. Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK'S POV. He sees Stevie McCormick conferring with a Mexican gang leader.  The Mexican hands Stevie a joint through a handshake. Derek turns and talks to two white guys who seem impressed. Stevie walks up and takes a hit off his joint.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: I was just talking about you.  You're Cammeron's boy? Derek turns and stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: His boy? No, I don't think so, man. I'm not anybody's boy.

dialogues.text: The men close in. Seth and Cam are blind to it.  Jerome raises the bat as they close in and we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stares at himself in the mirror and tries to find some stubble on his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares into the mirror in a coat and pants.  Danny rushes to get his things together.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I'm printing it up and we're out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Hurry up. Derek walks out into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the couch watching cartoons. She takes a jar of Vick's Vapor Rub and puts some on her chest. Derek walks in the room, bends over and kisses her on the forehead. Davina sits on the couch and writes. Derek just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Wow. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I gotta see my parole officer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVINA
dialogues.text: Hey Der? Do you have Excel on disk?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I've got everything on disk. Davina smiles and walks into the back bedroom.  Doris looks at Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: You look good. Derek smiles and caresses his mother's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: We're getting out of here soon.  Is that okay with you?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: I'd love it. (after a beat) Do you think I should color my hair?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Yes. He sits beside his mother and enjoys the moment.  He thinks to himself.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: I'm glad you made it back. I wasn't too sure I was going to see you again. You know how I get. Filled with regret, he nods.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: You think you'll be able to forgive me? Someday maybe?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: You're my son. Of course I will. Derek smiles and can't believe his tearful reaction.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Look at me. I'm such a pussy.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek plunks a quarter down the slot and removes a copy of the LA TIMES. Danny continues to skate ahead of him. Sensing danger, Derek looks back behind him. With no one in sight, he walks into a doughnut shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a guarded look outside. Everything seems normal. A bus drives by. A group of Mexican laborers, dressed for work and smiling, walk past in the other direction. Inside, a black woman orders a dozen doughnuts from a short Korean.man behind the counter. Her young daughter grabs her leg. Danny sits down and reads Derek's paper.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Maple bar and a...large milk. Derek smiles at the little girl while he waits. She wanders from her mother's leg and over towards Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: (to the girl) You look pretty. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TISHA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK GIRL
dialogues.text: (bashfully) Fine. DANNY'S POV. He looks up from the paper.  He watches the girl together with his brother.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK GIRL
dialogues.text: Tisha.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: How old are you, Tisha? She holds up four fingers. Derek smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MOTHER
dialogues.text: (staring at Derek) Come here, Tisha. Tisha returns to her mother and they quickly exit. Derek watches the girl as she continues to stare at him as they make their way down the street. Outside, a BLUE FORD screeches out front. Rasmussen and the Young Mark Fuhrman type from earlier get out and wait. Dr. Sweeney meets the duo and together they walk inside.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: We need to talk, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: How'd you find out I was here?

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: We were just at your apartment.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: Cammeron and Seth are in the ICU at St. Johns, Derek. They were jumped in front of Ben's Burgets early this morning. Derek thinks to himself for a few more seconds.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: How bad?

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: They'll live. (then) They must have been looking for somebody else. Derek stares at Rasmussen and walks away. Sweeney, who knows to walk over to him. He eyes TIGHT ON SWEENEY AND DEREK. The two lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Are they coming after you?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A. Sweeney sighs.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: I don't know. (after a long beat) You might have to talk to your old crew though. Derek looks over and analyzes the innocence of his brother.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I can't, Sweeney.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Try, Derek. Okay? Derek senses the danger in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Okay?  Before it explodes. Sweeney walks away and then turns back to Derek.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: And watch your back. Derek nods.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: (back to Danny) You showing up today? Danny looks at Sweeney and nods his head yes.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are outside the fence surrounding the field. Students head off to morning class.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Hey. Keep your head up, alright?  I'm  going to take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'll figure it out though. You gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. The two stare at each other as THE BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I gotta turn that paper in. Danny hops the fence with his backpack on. He looks back at Derek. Cops #1 and #2 sit in their car in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Come here. Derek puts his hand over the fence. Danny walks up and clasps it -- FINGERS INTERTWINED. Derek wants to say one thing but something else comes out.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I'll see you at home. Danny smiles at his brother and nods. Danny puts his ear phones on and heads to class. Derek watches his brother through the chain-link fence. Danny meets up with Lizzy and they soon disappear from Derek's sight. Derek turns and walks down the street.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: You need a lift anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Nope. Derek stops in his tracks, walks back over to the fence, and stares at the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students rush past them. Danny kisses Lizzy and she hurries off to class. He pushes on the men's room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny enters, sets his "AMERICAN HISTORY X" PAPER on top of the sink, and takes an unearthly long piss at the urinal. He finishes, flushes and turns. Standing there is LITTLE HENRY. A GUN IN HIS HAND.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.  What are you doing, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE HENRY
dialogues.text: (afraid) What does it look like I'm doin'?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Come on, man, no.  You don't want to do this. Come on.  Henry? THE DOOR SMACKS OPEN and Danny moves to grab the pistol. It discharges and a bullet rockets into Danny's chest. He SLAMS back into the URINAL and gasps for air. The force of the pistol knocks Henry to the ground. The two kids who just entered bolt for help. Danny slides to the tile, leaving a bloody trail. The two stare at each other - EYE TO EYE. THE BLOODSTAINED PAPER falls into the DAMP SINK. Danny inhales like glass is raking his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE HENRY
dialogues.text: (terrified) Danny? Danny's breathing slows to a choked whisper.  He blinks, coughs, twitches. And dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinyard? Danny? Henry watches teary-eyed with the same altered look Derek had after killing Lawrence. Together they FREEZE on the cold tile floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers and detectives monitor the area. Young students, including Lizzy and her friends, stand around and cry. Rasmussen brings THE BLOODY PAPER over to Sweeney. Sweeney looks at it for a moment but is interrupted.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: He won't let go. Will you talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek cradles his bloody brother. Sweeney walks over, crouches, and talks to Derek's back.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Derek? You gotta let him go, man. They gotta get him outta here.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I can't. Derek begins to cry outright. He can't control himself. He lets go of Danny's corpse and charges out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek embraces them. Doris grabs his face -- torn between love and hate. Guilt-ridden, Derek tears from them and storms down the hall with Sweeney soon in tow.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Derek! I know what you're thinkin' right now and I want you to forget about it!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: How the luck do you know what I'm thinkin', Sweeney!?

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Cause I'm thinkin' the same damn thing! Drowning in rage, Derek turns back to a misty eyed Sweeney.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: They shot him in a fucking...pisshole!

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: And goin' after them won't bring him back. Don't do it, Derek. Please, man. You've come too far. The war is over. Derek contemplates the situation and presses his tongue against his teeth, crackbrained. Sweeney slowly approaches and cautiously wraps his arms around the young man. Derek buries his tearing face in Sweeney's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: It stops now, Sweeney. Sweeney nods and the two lock eyes. Derek makes his way back to Doris and Davina and together, they grieve.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: We've heard it a million times, a Bible quote become cliche: "Vengeance is mine, sayeth the Lord."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A still of the two immediately after the murder. We move in tighter and tighter until we get close on Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V/O)
dialogues.text: Vengeance brought about by hate...and fear. When it points its head in our direction, we take notice and everything changes. The way we choose our friends, the way we protect our families, the way we create enemies out of strangers. (then) Welcome to America. TIGHT ON DANNY'S EYES. They are gently pushed shut by Henry's two small BLACK FINGERS.
